author: fluffy__cat
content: Listened to the Bankless podcast on MEV yesterday and came up with an 80-line proof of concept whereby block producers can select which transactions to include in a block, but must shuffle the order of transactions fairly and provide a proof of shuffling that validators can easily confirm. I'm don't expect this simple solution to actually solve MEV, but am interested in learning whether it may be a step in the right direction & if not, where its issues are.  Didn't see an MEV channel so I hope it's alright to share this here - https://colab.research.google.com/drive/19iWrLdnVddjaoECUHi2MuiGlMFXBpcsH -- appreciate any feedback.

author: protolambda
content: <@!167489045436432386> that construction, of shuffling the list with the previous block as seed, can be broken by adding/removing items to the list, especially if the transaction fees are paid to the miner itself.
